trans-unit.source: A summary of some of the key Event Hubs .NET client APIs.
trans-unit.target: A summary of some of the key Event Hubs .NET client APIs.

trans-unit.source: This article summarizes some of the key Event Hubs .NET client APIs.
trans-unit.target: This article summarizes some of the key Event Hubs .NET client APIs.

trans-unit.source: There are two categories: management and runtime APIs.
trans-unit.target: There are two categories: management and runtime APIs.

trans-unit.source: Runtime APIs consist of all operations needed to send and receive a message.
trans-unit.target: Runtime APIs consist of all operations needed to send and receive a message.

trans-unit.source: Management operations enable you to manage the Event Hubs entity state by creating, updating, and deleting entities.
trans-unit.target: Management operations enable you to manage the Event Hubs entity state by creating, updating, and deleting entities.

trans-unit.source: Monitoring scenarios span both management and runtime.
trans-unit.target: Monitoring scenarios span both management and runtime.

trans-unit.source: For detailed reference documentation on the .NET APIs, see the [.NET Class Library](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/jj933431.aspx) and [EventProcessorHost API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.aspx) references.
trans-unit.target: For detailed reference documentation on the .NET APIs, see the [.NET Class Library](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/jj933431.aspx) and [EventProcessorHost API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.servicebus.messaging.aspx) references.

trans-unit.source: To perform the following management operations you must have **Manage** permissions on the Service Bus namespace:
trans-unit.target: To perform the following management operations you must have **Manage** permissions on the Service Bus namespace:

trans-unit.source: These APIs provide resiliency to worker processes that may become unavailable, but distributing shards across available workers.
trans-unit.target: These APIs provide resiliency to worker processes that may become unavailable, but distributing shards across available workers.
